title: Reminiscences
author: Carlyle, Thomas
snippet: I think I always went by Bo'ness and steam so far, coach the remainder of the road in all subsequent journeys.

title: Reminiscences
author: Carlyle, Thomas
snippet: By steamer to Bo'ness and then by canal.

title: Art Rambles in the Highlands and Islands of Scotland ... With ... sketches, etc
author: Reid, John T.
snippet: He was an elder of a Congregational church there : that body have.no place of meeting in Bo'ness, even inLinlithgow it is but weak, and he esteemed it right to keep to the cause whilethe cause held together.

title: Art Rambles in the Highlands and Islands of Scotland ... With ... sketches, etc
author: Reid, John T.
snippet: The Bo'ness well*water was in great demand; women brought stoups, children pitchers and jugs, well-tanned lads came from their ships with strong pailsof Dutchland make.

title: Art Rambles in the Highlands and Islands of Scotland ... With ... sketches, etc
author: Reid, John T.
snippet: Bo'ness looked so invitingly old-fashioned,that I was drawn to it, and jumped into the shore-bound boat in companywith a grey-clad baker returning from a pie-selling expedition with a pie-box of

title: Art Rambles in the Highlands and Islands of Scotland ... With ... sketches, etc
author: Reid, John T.
snippet: To make up for so many digressions, permit my pen to jump at one leapfrom Cramond to Bo'ness (Borrowstowness).

title: A Voyage round Great Britain; with short views of Aberdeen, Balmoral, ... Fécamp, Havre and Paris
author: Hargreaves, Thomas
snippet: Nearly opposite to Bo'ness is the village ofCulross, with the Hen and Chickens Bank just infront.

title: A Voyage round Great Britain; with short views of Aberdeen, Balmoral, ... Fécamp, Havre and Paris
author: Hargreaves, Thomas
snippet: There is a good harbour, though small, at Bo'ness,a little above, while higher still is a large iron-worksat Kinneil.

title: Early Travellers in Scotland. Edited by P. Hume Brown. [With maps.]
author: Brown, Peter Hume.
